fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to confirm the Insert Wiki Markup dialog
OSX startup scripts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33686].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
# edit a page
# type (//

The date insertion trigger does not fire on the //.
fields.summary: Inserting a date using the // trigger does not work when following an open round bracket
Option to choose fonts in editor
Next and Back Buttons Option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33680].
  {panel}

If you install Confluence on an Oracle schema with a dot on it, you'll face "Could not get unique fields for table" errors. 

It would be nice to have a warning if the user inserts something like CONFLUENCE5.5 telling him this is unsupported and recommending the use of underscores instead of dots. i.e.: CONFLUENCE5_5

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33678].
  {panel}

Using those browsers in Windows, Linux, and OSX when a .mp4/.mp3 file is embedded with auto play unchecked, it still plays automatically. In other browsers it does not happen, waiting for the play click as expected.

Tested with:
- Safari Version 8.0.6 (10600.6.3)
- Chrome Version 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit)
- Firefox Version 38.0.1

Steps to reproduce:
1. Insert an .mp4 video in a Confluence page.
2. Let the "auto play" checkbox unchecked.
3. Open the page in any of those browsers.

Workaround (Chrome):

Use the [Disable HTML5 Autoplay|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/disable-html5-autoplay/efdhoaajjjgckpbkoglidkeendpkolai?hl=en] to disable all HTML5 Autoplay in Chrome
fields.summary: Chrome/Firefox/Safari ignores auto play option on multimedia macro

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33662].
  {panel}

Greetings, we have recent begun cleaning up our Wiki by leveraging both manual arching and the plug-in from Midori.

We have about 15,000 pages of which 7,000 or more should be archived.

The challenge is that the Popular Posts activity stream is including content that was recently moved to an Archive space based on the popularity of the content. 

In some cases, we have content from 3+ years ago showing up as popular and with our overall activity of Confluence, it's preventing us from doing any more archiving.

I'm happy to provide further details if possible.

-Jim

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33648]. {panel} I have found a detail which would be important to put on the documentation about [Importing Pages from Disk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Importing+Pages+from+Disk]: When importing a text file, Confluence ignores all the new lines and space characters, breaking the user's text layout. So, it turned out that adding the tag *
* at the beginning of the text file and closing it with *
* at the end of the file makes Confluence correctly import it, keeping the space/new line. Having said that, I would like to add a note about it to the official documentation. Example: To import text files keeping the file's layout: Add the tag {{
}} at the beginning of the file and close this tag with {{
}} at the end. In case you are using Unix like environment, this job can be done to all files inside a specific directory using the following command line: 1. Go to the directory where the files are in. 2. Run {code}for i in $(ls); do echo "
" >> m$i; cat $i >> m$i; echo "
" >> m$i; mv m$i $i; done {code} This is also an update request from a customer.
fields.summary: Update on latest documentation about Importing Pages from Disk
Make 'm' shortcut do a quote comment if you have text selected

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33642].
  {panel}

The number of columns the gallery macro uses must currently be set to a fixed number. However there are cases where I would prefer the images to be flowed (in CSS-speak), that is:

For e.g. 9 images and 3 cols:
*Currently:*
Wide window: 3 rows x 3 cols
Medium window: 3 rows x 3 cols
Small window: 3 rows x 3 cols + scrollbar
…
*Requested:*
Wide window: 2 rows x 5 cols
medium window: 3 rows x 3 cols
small window: 5 rows x 2 cols
…

This could be done by setting the number of columns to "*" or "0".
fields.summary: Gallery Macro: Flowed layout / variable column count
Copy and Paste the Content from Other Editors

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33637].
  {panel}

I have a user that is experiencing an issue with Confluence. Below is the text of the issue provided me:



There are actually 2 bugs, and they are manifest on this page:

https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Current+Train+Assignments?moved=true

Bug #1)
The priority order that we actually want is from this page: https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Cross-Prioritization+Dashboard

So in order to only have to do the ordering once, I put this this expert/expert-include of the "Approved Backlog". It was working for a few weeks. But about 3 weeks ago, I noticed that some of the features are missing and some of the features are listed twice.
Example: AMT2.0/Revamp - which is the last on this list (https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Cross-Prioritization+Dashboard)…

(see attachment Conf1)


Does not appear on the expert-include page (https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Current+Train+Assignments?moved=true) at all:
   
(see attachment Conf2)

You'll also note that "Exclude match/phrase" is listed twice. (Top and bottom of the 2nd picture)

(see attachment Conf3)

Bug #2)
In the 2nd column, there is an adhoc board with title "New Board". When you move pages up and down in the list, the ordering used to be preserved, even after you refreshed. But now, if you move the pages, and refresh, the ordering (or priority that we use this board for) is not preserved and goes back to a different ordering. 

This priority preservation and planning boards are vital to our planning process, so we really need these fixed!

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When trying to share the page, Confluence does not recognize the groups _confluence-users_ and _confluence-administrators_.

h3. Customer Impact

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any page
# Click the 'Share' button
# Start typing 'confluence-users'

h3. Expected Results
'confluence-users' group is shown and added to the share list, so we can share the page to all members of the group.

h3. Actual Results
The group is not found:
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

*Application logs:*
Nothing specific in the logs.

h3. Notes
* Jira groups are showing (like jira-administrators, jira-software-users, etc)
* Custom groups are working fine.

{panel:title=Orignal request}
Hi,

Confluence does not recognize the groups _confluence-users_ and _confluence-administrators_ when trying to share a page. The page share autocomplete does not find the group at all.

Steps to reproduce:
# Login to Confluence.
# Open any page.
# Click on Share.
# Start typing: conf
--> The list of groups does not include confluence-users.

This works fine for user created groups.
 {panel}
fields.summary: Autocomplete does not find predefined groups when sharing a page

If your space is using the Page Properties Macro and you export the space to PDF, there is a macro error in place of all positions where the Page Property Macro exists.

_Note:_ In the export progress screen, the error message will always name the last page in the export, even if doesn't use the macro. 
Search Confluence using {{macroName: detailssummary*}} to identify the actual affected pages.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33609].
  {panel}

h5.Synopsis

When browsing to a space that you don't have permissions for, Confluence give inconsistent warning messages - see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33608.

If a user does not have access to a space, it would be great if the System Administrator could allow people to request access to the Space - either on a system wide basis, or a per Space basis.

The flow of access request would work much like the current process for requesting access to a restricted page.
fields.summary: For spaces users don't have permission for, allow users to request access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33608].
  {panel}

h5.Synopsis:
If you browse to a specific page in a restricted space that you don't have access to, you'll receive a 404 error stating that the page cannot be found, or perhaps that you don't have access to it.

As per [Matt Ryall's comment on CONF-9239|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9239?focusedCommentId=149238&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-149238], this is to ensure that we do not "leak information about the existence or non-existence of spaces which users don't have permission to see."

A few comments later in the same ticket, [Charles Miller comments that|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9239?focusedCommentId=150837&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-150837] you can bypass the ambiguous 404 message to get a hard "Not Permitted" or "Doesn't Exist" error when browsing to the space key directly.

If you have a restricted space with the key "RS", and the page title is "Restricted Space Home", the following is true:

# Browsing to {{/display/RS/Restricted+Space+Home}} produces the ambigous 404 error
# Browsing to {{/display/RS/}} displays a "Not Permitted" action.
# Browsing to {{/display/FOO/}} (that doesn't exist) displays a "Page Not Found" error.
fields.summary: Confluence is inconsistent in error messages for restricted spaces

fields.description:

In this case, I totally lose my navigation ability.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33597].
  {panel}

As a user, I would like to be redirected to Personal Spaces (if available) when clicking on usernames in the People Directory.

*Current behavior*: you are redirected to the user's Profile (/display/~admin for example).

*Expected behavior*: to be directed to /spaces/viewspace.action?key=~admin.  This especially makes sense when clicking on *People with Personal Spaces* in the People Directory.


I've tested this in a few older versions and it appeared to be already behaving the expected way in versions 4.x, and changed in 5.0.1.  So this might be considered a regression instead of an improvement request.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33573].
  {panel}

When using a screen reader to interpret Confluence (in this example, the screen reader used was JAWS screen reader), there are a number of problems :

* The first item on the page (a logo?) has not be labelled, it just says “graphic”
* The link between “Help” and the user’s name has been labelled “0”
* The item that follows immediately after the user’s name (a logo again?) is unlabelled and just says “graphic”
* It impossible to upload files as the ‘browse for files’ option does not appear to be visible to a screenreader or accessible using the keyboard

These should be rectified to make Confluence more accessible to visually-impaired users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33566].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Page properties report macro is not sorting DD/MM/YYYY in the proper order; that is, going by month year first, then month, then day. Instead, it is sorting in alpha-numeric order.

!date_sort.png!

h3. Environment
* Confluence
* Page Properties Macros 4.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33550].
  {panel}


It seems that the links to confluence attachments are not permalinks (stabe links). 

Example:

https://example.com/download/attachments/116065791/file.pdf?version=1&modificationDate=1361208962871&api=v2

Instead they should be like

https://example.com/download/attachments/116065791/file.pdf

And obviously, uploading a new version of an attachment should not change its permalink.

That's an essential feature for any HTML application. By not conforming with this Confluence is breaking HTTP standards and making indexing and search much harder.

Also, the same design flaw does break lots of links from other web applications (when the attachment is updated).
fields.summary: provide permalinks to confluence attachments

h6. Overview 
This was originally raised as a bug in [CONF-32989|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32989]. After reviewing the issue, it can be considered an *Improvement* to have the following in the *JIRA Issue Macro*:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33547].
  {panel}

Thanks to [~sday@atlassian.com]

We could see that the email doesn't show the number of lines / last line matched in the report. This is actually why there's a discrepancy.

Going further on this, we actually have a bunch of regex patterns in Sisyphus that match the same thing. e.g:

CONF-13900 vs CONFKB394463234
CONF-29000 vs CONFKB355369050
CONFKB151519398 vs CONFKB331914082
CONFKB217743871 vs CONFKB223217565
CONFKB282169412 vs CONFKB282173819

The manual scan puts all matches into a TreeSet, which will eliminate duplicates based on the ordering algorithm. The problem is because a few issues match the exact same line, and we sort based on the last line matched, only one match result "wins out", the other is considered a duplicate (even though it's a different match).

I think the best way to address this would actually be to make the email report consistent with the manual scan, in that the number of lines + last matching line are shown. This will actually mean that for this particular customers case, the scheduled email will start reporting less matches than before. Ideally we should also be looking at some of the regex collisions above and fixing those too.
fields.summary: Improve regex patterns when using Hercules X Scheduled Scan

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33546].
  {panel}

It's quite hard to convince the users to leave a comment in the 'What did you change?' field after they have modified a page. They just ignore the field. Since 'Notify watchers' is switched on by default, the watchers get notification mails but they cannot see what the change was about. To find out, they have to click the link and check. Quite often it was a small change and not important for them, so this proves wasted time.

We would like configuration options in Confluence administration:
* 'What did you change?' required field yes / no
* 'Notify watchers' default on / off
fields.summary: Add configuration option for 'What did you change?' or 'Notify watchers'

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33527].
  {panel}

UPDATE: note I entered this in the wrong place, this is a bug in JIRA not in Confluence. This issue can be deleted, I've re-entered it as JIRA-38127.

------

The "Edit Name" functionality on an Epic in the Agile Planning View is essentially broken.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an Epic with a reasonable story name - maybe around 7-8 words, 40-50 characters
2. Switch to the Agile Planning view which shows the Versions/Epics/Issues columns.
3. Find your epic, click on the drop-down menu indicator and select "Edit Name"
4. Type in a new name about the same length as the old name.

Result: the edit field prevents you from typing in more than 30 characters
Expected: the edit field doesn't have any stricter limitations than if you were editing the name directly in the Epic's editor view

(continuing)
5. Go ahead an accept the new, shortened name in this Edit Name text field
6. Now open the Epic in its full editor view
Result: the new name assigned to the epic is apparently only a special alias for that planning view, not actually the new name of the epic. In fact if you toggle open the disclosure in the planning view you can see the epic now has two names - the long original name, and the constrained name that was just introduced by this (bogus?) "Edit Name" command
Expected: if we're chaining the name of the epic, it should change the name of the epic, not introduce some new bizarre alias only visible in the planning GUI

(continuing)
8. Get rid of the bogus short name that the Planning view "Edit Name" command has introduced
Expected: there's an obvious way to do this
Actual: there's no obvious way to do this

Thanks for fixing!
fields.summary: Planning view Epic "Edit Name" functionality is limited, broken, irreversible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33522].
  {panel}

One common total crash for Confluence is when it does run out of database connection. 

Any reliable web application should be able to resist to a peak in number of request and not to fully crash when this happens. 

This is also a security issue because it means that anyone could easily bring the server down just by issuing requests to it.

The correct behavior is to stop processing new requests when this happens and to respond with HTTP 503, also logging an ERROR.
fields.summary: prevent crashing when running out of database connections

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33466].
  {panel}

When using SSO, it can be difficult to trigger a sync of the opposite type that you have configured.

There are currently two sync types with remote directories - full and incremental. Occasionally, you may want to trigger a sync of the type that is not configured - if you're using incremental sync, you may wish to trigger a full sync on occasion, and vice versa.

Currently, you must undertake the following steps:

# Shut down Confluence
# Remove the SSO Configuration
# Start Confluence
# Log in as a local admin
# Update the option for the sync setting on the remote directory
# Perform the sync
# Shut down Confluence
# Restore the SSO Configuration
# Start Confluence

Shutting down Confluence creates a window of downtime for non admin users, as they are unable to log in due to the lack of SSO.
fields.summary: When using Single Sign On (SSO), triggering a sync is painful.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33465].

If you are viewing a page that has an image which is attached to some other page it is not clear where the image is actually from.

The only way to tell now is to Edit the page and then hover over the image and view the tooltip, see attached image.

It would be nicer if this information were presented somewhere less transient. Note that the Page Information page does list the pages under "Outgoing Links" but that does not tell you which images map to which pages.

The Image Properties might be a good place to put the information. After all where the image is located is a property of the image.
fields.summary: Improve attachment information for images, currently in tooltip
